message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the impact of climate change on maize yield using a panel dataset of 33 countries in Sub-Saharan Africa from 1980-2015, and complement it with data on temperature and rainfall patterns obtained from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS).", "dataset": ["panel dataset of 33 countries in Sub-Saharan Africa", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]},
{"sentence": "In this study, we utilized two datasets to explore the link between political governance and economic growth: the World Governance Indicators and the World Development Indicators, both collected by the World Bank.", "dataset": ["World Governance Indicators", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]},
{"sentence": "The impact of extractive industries in developing economies is analyzed using a unique dataset that combines granular data on company activities, employment, and production sourced from the Mining Local Procurement Reporting Mechanism and macroeconomic data provided by the World Bank Enterprise Survey.", "dataset": ["Mining Local Procurement Reporting Mechanism", "World Bank Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Jobs & Development", "Macroeconomics"]},
{"sentence": "We use household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) database to examine the effectiveness of cash transfer programs in reducing poverty, supplemented by administrative data on social protection from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "World Bank administrative data on social protection"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Social Protection"]},
{"sentence": "Gender inequality in income is investigated using data from the World Bank's Women, Business and the Law dataset, covering over 190 economies, coupled with the Gender Statistics database, which contains data on economic participation and access to education, health, and public life indicators.", "dataset": ["Women, Business and the Law", "Gender Statistics database"], "topic": ["Gender"]},
{"sentence": "We collect satellite data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) on smoke plumes emanating from wildfires in the eucalyptus forests of Australia, and integrate it with ground-level observations obtained from sensors deployed along different parts of the forest to analyze the spatiotemporal dynamics of fires.", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) satellite data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]},
{"sentence": "To better understand the relationship between health expenditure and economic activity, we use two datasets: the Global Burden of Disease Study for tracking health outcomes and cost-effectiveness assessments, and the Worldwide National Health Accounts for measuring health financing and health spending trends.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease Study", "Worldwide National Health Accounts"], "topic": ["Health", "Macroeconomics"]},
{"sentence": "Assessing the potential of renewable energy resources in meeting the growing demand for power involves aggregating data from multiple sources. For example, using data on wind turbines from the International Energy Agency combined with information on solar panels from the US Department of Energy, we investigate the feasibility of a hybrid energy system for a city in Texas.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency data on wind turbines", "US Department of Energy data on solar panels"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]},
{"sentence": "We studied the spillover effects of bilateral trade relations among developed countries, using open-access data on trade flows from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development, and merged it with consumer expenditure data from the World Input-Output Database.", "dataset": ["United Nations Conference on Trade and Development", "World Input-Output Database"], "topic": ["Trade", "Competitiveness"]},
{"sentence": "Using a comprehensive dataset of household demographics, asset ownership, and education levels from the Haiti Living Standards Survey, we examine the determinants of vulnerability to tropical storms in coastal regions, complementing it with weather data provided by the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF).", "dataset": ["Haiti Living Standards Survey", "European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF) weather data"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty"]}]
